# <img src="[https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16883585/75211541-da01c680-5749-11ea-9f6c-096dc2ec4dbc.png](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/16841846/288079133-51a8769f-6abe-4140-bd83-4bb11fe7a831.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..nOqwjtkSLYOlCwElcCbZsdFoaW4TGaeSldCATToqBWI)https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/16841846/288079133-51a8769f-6abe-4140-bd83-4bb11fe7a831.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..nOqwjtkSLYOlCwElcCbZsdFoaW4TGaeSldCATToqBWI" width="30"/> MetaPAL: Free, Open-Source Software for Integrating Proteomics and Machine Learning [![Follow us on Twitter](https://img.shields.io/twitter/follow/smith_chem_wisc?label=Twitter&style=social)](https://twitter.com/smith_chem_wisc)
A framework for reading and writing ML-ready proteomics data

## Unique Spectrum Identifiers - USI
A USI can be used to uniquely identify any mass spectrum from any file hosted on the ProteomeXChange. 

USIs take the following format: mzspec:(Dataset Identifier):(File Name):(Index Type):(Index Number):(Optional Interpretation)

Example: mzspec:PXD000561:Adult_CD4Tcells_bRP_Elite_28_f15:scan:12517:SYEAALLPLYMEGGFVEVIHDK/3
